snippet: The legislation will allow Poland’s new conservative government to appoint and dismiss the executives in charge of public television and radio broadcasters.
abstract: Poland institutes law allowing its new conservative-led government to appoint and dismiss executives in charge of public radio and television broadcasters; European Union opposes measure on grounds it imperils press freedom and schedules rule of law discussion for January.
lead_paragraph: The legislation will allow Poland’s new conservative government to appoint and dismiss the executives in charge of public television and radio broadcasters.

headline.main: Poland’s President Approves Controls on State Media, Alarming E.U. Leaders
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Poland: Media Law Stirs Concerns
